spotlightData.headline: Empowering women to pursue their dreams
spotlightData.subheadline: Investing in women’s economic empowerment and freedom around the world.
spotlightData.imageFooter: Alcina, a farm owner since 2016, grows and sells vegetables to support her three children.
spotlightData.subheadsTitle: $1.4 billion raised to support 3.7 million female borrowers around the world
subheads: 81% of all borrowers on Kiva  are women
Kiva Funded more than 150,000 women in 2021
spotlightData.partnerText: Worldwide, women have much less economic opportunity, security, and freedom than men. Support women starting their own businesses, going to school, or investing in the health of their communities and families.

spotlightData.headline: A world of opportunity for refugees
spotlightData.subheadline: Empowering refugees to rebuild their lives and communities
spotlightData.imageFooter: Fadi, a 21-year-old Syrian refugee in Lebanon, works as a mechanic in an auto-shop.
spotlightData.subheadsTitle: Over $29,000,000 raised to support over 32,000 refugee borrowers around the world
subheads: Kiva works in 4 of the top countries with the largest refugee populations
PROVIDING TOOLS AND RESOURCES FOR REFUGEE ENTREPRENEURS
spotlightData.partnerText: Forced to flee their homes due to conflict or persecution, refugees often have limited resources and few opportunities. Your support empowers refugees to create better futures for themselves and their families.

spotlightData.headline: Breaking down barriers, building up marginalized communities
spotlightData.subheadline: Investing in marginalized populations in the U.S. to lift up those who are overlooked
spotlightData.imageFooter: Yolanda tends her urban farm in Oakland, CA – where she provides organic and local goods to her community
spotlightData.subheadsTitle: Funded almost 9000 borrowers in communities across the United States
subheads: 95% of all U.S. borrowers on Kiva are in marginalized communities
95% of all U.S. borrowers on Kiva  are in marginalized communities
95% of all U.S. borrowers on Kiva  are in marginalized communities
spotlightData.partnerText: From Indigenous communities to veterans and low-income populations, many U.S. communities are  overlooked and underserved. Your support starts businesses, enables education, and grows communities.

spotlightData.headline: Support smallholder farms and farmers providing for their families and uplifting their neighbors
spotlightData.subheadline: Build up families by helping diversify their crops, commercialize their small farms, or simply rebuilding or relocating their farms.
spotlightData.imageFooter: Chan working on her organic farm in northern Thailand, where she grows rice and sells chicken eggs.
spotlightData.subheadsTitle: Kiva has supported 1.1 million farmers and farms around the world.
subheads: about 30% of all Kiva borrowers are smallholder farmers
Kiva funded more than 100,000 smallholder farms in 2022
Help global families and small communities thrive
spotlightData.carouselTitle: SUPPORT THESE farms and farmers TODAY
spotlightData.partnerText: Smallholder farms are vital to healthy families and robust communities around the world. Your support builds community sustainability, enables growth, and empowers individuals.
